greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{d|n} prime(d).
example: a(4) = 42 because the divisors of 4 are: 1, 2 and 4; and prime(1) * prime(2) * prime(4) = 2 * 3 * 7 = 42.
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(d=divisors(n)); prod(i=1, #d, prime(d[i])) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Aug 05 2016
(Perl) use ntheory ":all"; sub a275700 { vecprod(map { nth_prime($_) } divisors($_[0])); } # _Dana Jacobsen_, Aug 09 2016
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Aug 05 2016
